p: Furthermore, among the novel cellular targets identified in the ZIKV NS4A interactome is ANKLE2, a protein previously shown to cause autosomal recessive microcephaly in humans [ 41]. Interestingly, in an ANKLE2-heterozygous mutant drosophila model, expression of NS4A reduced brain size, suggesting that NS4A might induce neurotoxic effects, at least under limiting amounts of functional ANKLE2.
